message: As usual, pillars made of dull black stone are standing.
Not just while I'm watching, it'll probably keep standing there even after I'm dead.
There are carvings on the pillars.
The style seems to slightly resemble that of the Mediterranean, but the material looks different from the easily workable limestone.

A giant stone pillar is standing there. It's probably big enough that it would take two or three adults holding hands to just barely wrap around it. It looks pretty worn down by rain and salty winds, but it seems like it'll still last a few hundred years more at this rate.
It's a relief depicting some bizarre figure, neither fish nor human, which Gardner insists must be the god worshipped in this temple.
I've never seen such a weird scene anywhere else.

name: Thomas
message: 何度見たって同じだぜ。あんなもんに価値なんてありゃし　　　　　　ないさ。

name: Gardner
message: What are you talking about！ You don't understand just how strange and rare that thing is.

name: Gardner
message: This is a country of Christians, so the fact that a culture that openly worshipped another god could exist here is already surprising.

name: Thomas
message: Then, isn't it just an even older building?

name: Gardner
message: If there's an ancient artifact from before Christ, and no one has ever discovered it until now, that's a huge scoop！

name: Thomas
message: Just some bored person's prank, I bet.

name: Jonathan
message: What do the villagers say about these ruins? Is there any kind of legend or something?

name: Gardner
message: That's the problem......
The villagers don't seem very happy about people talking about these ruins. They won't say a single word.

name: Jonathan
message: I'd heard it's a pretty closed-off village, but......
That's when it happened. An old man appeared before me.

The old man seemed quite advanced in age. His face was covered in deeply carved wrinkles, and his receding forehead was marked with age spots unique to the elderly. His clothes were way too light for this season—it made me feel cold just looking at him.

name: Old man
message: You folks... what're you doing over there？

The old man said this in a voice as thin as a mosquito's buzz. Maybe he was a fisherman in the past—his red face was just what you'd expect from someone who's spent years in the sea breeze. Even though he was totally worn down now, you could just barely catch a glimpse of the muscle he must've had back in his prime.

name: Old man
message: Ah... you are...
The old man ignores the other two entirely, staring intently at my face.
What in the world did he sense from looking at my face?

name: Old man
message: Ia... fhtagn... mglw’nafh Cthulhu R’lyeh...
The words that came from the old man's mouth were a string of incomprehensible terms, none of which I recognized, nor could I even guess what language they belonged to.

name: Jonathan
message: Professor, about those picture-like things carved into the stone pillar...

name: Gardner
message: Yes. It seems, at least from what I imagine, that these structures were built for the 'god' depicted on that mural.

name: Jonathan
message: What in the world is it supposed to be？

name: Gardner
message: Take a closer look.

name: Thomas
message: Looks kind of like a person, and kind of like a fish. Maybe it's some sorta mermaid or whatever. But no matter how you look, that's definitely a dude.
As for me, when it comes to stuff like this, I've got about as much knowledge as Thomas—pretty much none. I have no idea what this picture is supposed to mean.

name: Thomas
message: A dude, huh... In that case, I'd rather have one of those sirens or whatever, the gals that mess with sailors using their singing voices.

name: Gardner
message: Even if all that's waiting is drowning for you？
Besides, that's not an object of worship. It's folklore, you know, just local legends.

name: Jonathan
message: Is that a 'god'？
Are you telling me it was revered so much that they went out of their way to build such a grand Temple for it？

name: Thomas
message: Sure does feel kinda scary though.

name: Gardner
message: Can't say anything for sure！ After all, we don't even know who built it. But since it's close to the sea, it wouldn't be strange if they enshrined some kind of sea god.
Thomas looks like he just can't accept it.
For Thomas, who is clearly a total outsider to this kind of stuff, to go after an expert like Gardner—it's pretty damn rude, but...

name: Thomas
message: Really, though? Not buying it. Why would a fish god hand out fish to fishermen? I'd get it if it stopped them from catching any, though.
Maybe it's because the picture itself is so old and crude, but to me it feels kind of ominous.

name: Gardner
message: Just because it's a god that promises a big catch doesn't mean that's why they worshipped it. Maybe they were afraid of something—like, to prevent being cursed, you know? There could be all kinds of reasons.

name: Jonathan
message: It might just be my imagination, but to me it really feels like something extremely evil...

name: Gardner
message: Maybe they're actually that kind of god, you know. That's what you'd call a cult of evil gods！
Gardner said that, glancing sideways at Thomas. It was like he was already assuming Thomas was a worshipper of some evil god.
On top of pillars that look like the ruins of a Temple, there's something like an emblem or maybe a mural. The details have been worn down by erosion, so you can't really see it clearly.
Amidst the ruins of the mostly-collapsed structures, these stone pillars, looking like either a gate or a Temple, stand tall and dignified without a trace of collapse.
Anyway, I don't think someone like me, an outsider, is going to make any big discoveries just by staring at this.
目の前にそびえる巨大な石の建造物は一体何を意味するのだろう。
It looks like either a gate to a fortress city, or the entrance to the Temple. Either way, it feels really unnatural for something like this to be here in a place like this.
The sky is a dull, pale overcast, and I can't even tell if it's midday or twilight with evening closing in. Even as I stand here, it feels like the chill from the sea is slowly creeping in.
Looks like they've gotten completely bored.
Whatever Thomas was scheming when he came here, it seems he couldn't find what he was looking for in the Ruins.
トマスは、一通り遺跡を見て回った途端、すっかり興味を失ってしまったようだ。彼がどういう素性の人間なのかは解らないが、この種の学問に熱心なようにも見えない。

name: Gardner
message: You've been staring at me for a while now, huh？
Didn't you come to look at the Ruins? If there's something you don't understand, just say it straight.
Gardner is smiling as if just being inside the Ruins brings him joy, glancing around at the various artifacts.
This cold must really get to the elderly, but there's no sign at all that it bothers him.
When the old man realized that I didn't understand what he was saying at all, he suddenly looked embarrassed. Seems like he mistook me for someone else.
The old man still seems to be mistaking me for someone else. He's standing there, quiet, almost like he's sucking up to someone powerful.
That old man is staring at me with eyes full of fear mixed with awe.
I have no idea what kind of words he said, but there's no doubt he's mistaking me for someone else.

name: Thomas
message: Let's get going soon.
So... at that place called Gilman House or whatever, the pub. I mean, it's not exactly fancy, but they'll serve booze that warms you up, right?

name: Thomas
message: It's way bigger than I imagined.
Something　smaller...　yeah,　like　the　kind　you　often　see　out　in　the　countryside.

name: Jonathan
message: What is it？

name: Thomas
message: The old man at the rectory, you know, he says it all proudly.

name: Thomas
message: 『This is the site of the 14th-century Church our parish is so proud of.' Or so they say.　　　　　　 But when you look at it, all you see is a dirty, half-collapsed brick wall.

So does he actually have the refined hobby of going around looking at local relics, despite how he looks? He must be going through a lot of trouble exploring Ruins in remote, inconvenient countryside areas.
I remember him saying he often leaves London for work, but maybe the real reason is to check out the ruins.

name: Jonathan
message: The ruins here are obviously something completely different from that kind of stuff.
Even at a glance, you could call them an important cultural heritage.

name: Thomas
message: Suspicious-looking pillars and walls, stone statues I have no idea what they're even supposed to be... and you call this cultural heritage, huh......

name: Gardner
message: I shouldn't butt in too much, so just look around however you want. If there's anything you don't understand, just ask me anything.

name: Gardner
message: Well, seeing this magnificent relic up close, don't you really get what I was trying to say？
I wonder about that.........
I feel like Gardner only ever said stuff like 'extremely valuable' or 'super rare' anyway.

name: Gardner
message: What could the statues and murals of strange beings scattered all over the Ruins mean? Even though you're no expert, if you share your opinion, it might help my research.

name: Jonathan
message: No... I really don't think an outsider like me could possibly make any new discoveries...

name: Gardner
message: Oh, enough with the lectures.

name: Jonathan
message: Why are you keeping quiet? Is there something inconvenient if you say it out loud?

name: Thomas
message: Just leave it, will you? Feels kinda bad, like we're picking on an old man or something.
I can't really see this guy as the type to worry about such things. Honestly, it just looks like he's trying to keep us away from this old man and the ruins. Or is this just my imagination？

name: Jonathan
message: That's not gonna happen. Depending on this old man, I might actually be able to achieve the real reason I came to Arkham.

name: Old man
message: I don't know anything.
It's　true......　I　haven't　betrayed　anyone！
The old man suddenly looked extremely scared, even trembling a little as he backed away and disappeared from in front of us.

name: Gardner
message: Ah, shit！
Jonathan, it's because you started asking those dumbass questions that they left.

name: Jonathan
message: Dumbass？
How can you say for sure that it's pointless to the professor?

name: Gardner
message: But there was a way more important question than that！

name: Thomas
message: He already left, so there's nothing we can do about it, right?
We should get going too, don’t you think?

name: Gardner
message: That old man must know something important about the ruins.

name: Thomas
message: If you put it that way, then probably all the villagers except you and us know a lot about this junk. That old guy’s the same—they just won’t talk, y’know?

name: Gardner
message: Hey, old man, you must know something about these ruins, right? What do those reliefs displayed in the temple and the broken statues mean?

name: Old man
message: I don't know... I don't know anything！
The old man shut his mouth tight, as if he was forbidden from talking about it.

name: Thomas
message: Told you so, didn't I?
This old guy's gotten a bit weird, you know.

name: Jonathan
message: Old man, it seems like you mistook me for someone else, but do you know someone who looks a lot like me？
Like Thomas says, is it just the ramblings of an old man who's simply losing his memory? Or is it something about my past
That woman who connects me and Arkham,
I wonder if there's some kind of connection？

name: Jonathan
message: Please say it！
Who were your words directed at?

name: Old man
message: I just...
Ah, it's because you had that Innsmouth look...
What does an Innsmouth face mean?
What is the old man saying, I wonder.

name: Jonathan
message: What does 'Innsmouth Look' mean？
Could you say it more clearly?

name: Thomas
message: What the hell... is with this creepy old man.
Jonathan, it looks like they've got something they want to say to you.
It's true, but I don't know this old man at all, and I have absolutely no idea what he's trying to say.

name: Old man
message: Ngai-Nguag-Bugu=Shoggoth...... We humbly　　　　　worship the Almighty God we devote ourselves to......

Once again, what came out of the old man's mouth was a mysterious word with a ring similar to a medieval dark age curse. What does 'Almighty God' mean? There's no way he's saying that I'm God, right? Could it have something to do with these ruins?

name: Gardner
message: W-wait a minute！

name: Gardner
message: What do you mean by that comment just now? What is this 'Almighty God' thing supposed to be?
Before I could open my mouth, Gardner questioned the old man.
He's about to lunge at the Old man any second now.

name: Jonathan
message: Excuse me, but aren't you mistaking me for someone else?

name: Gardner
message: Damn it！ That doesn't matter. More importantly, tell me what that weird chant-like gibberish you were just saying means.

name: Thomas
message: Why are you getting so worked up? It's just the ramblings of an old man who's lost his marbles.

name: Gardner
message: You idiot, you think this can be brushed off as nonsense?！
There’s definitely some kind of hidden meaning behind what was just said.

name: Thomas
message: Cut it out already.
Hey Jonathan, let's get going already. It's not fun wasting time with these guys！

name: Old man
message: S-So, you're...not, huh？
Fish Scale Inn
Plaza
General store
Gilman House
